entry.title: Julien added 'Giovanni’s Room'
entry.content:
📚 “Giovanni’s Room” by James Baldwin ⭐️ Rated: 4/5
📝 "Giovanni’s Room is a sentimental love story, sometimes bordering on melodrama, but it’s Baldwin’s writing that makes it the classic it is. His flow is effortless, and his descriptions of emotions, places, and people are so precise, you truly feel like you’re in the room. The plot may not be the most remarkable, but that only highlights the strength of Baldwin’s craft. This is a novel carried entirely by voice and atmosphere, and it works beautifully. —— Giovanni’s Room est un roman sentimental,..."

entry.content:
📚 “The Case of the Blonde Bonanza” by Erle Stanley Gardner ⭐️ Rated: 3/5
📝 "The Case of the Blonde Bonanza is a slightly offbeat Perry Mason mystery, where the actual crime shows up rather late in the narrative and is resolved rather quickly. But the build-up to the murder is clever and refreshingly different from the usual formula. Set away from Los Angeles, it gives both Perry, and the reader, a welcome break from the recurring courtroom clashes with Hamilton Burger and the gruff presence of Lt. Tragg.
